You are right, it is difficult for companies to plan for every possible crisis as unexpected situations can arise, making it impossible to anticipate every type of crisis. However, developing a crisis management plan can help companies to prepare for many common types of crises and build a foundation for responding to emerging or novel crises.

Acting quickly and decisively in the moment is indeed crucial to handle a crisis effectively. However, having a plan in place will help companies respond more effectively in several ways, such as:

1) A Crisis Management Plan can enable companies to act quickly and decisively when a crisis occurs. By having an established plan in place, employees will be aware of their roles and responsibilities, and thus response can be prompt, efficient and effective.

2) A Crisis Management Plan can help companies remain composed and flexible under pressure. By delegating responsibilities, the management can focus on the bigger picture rather than micromanaging tasks, leading to a faster, more well-rounded response. 

3) A Crisis Management Plan also enables a company to "improvise with a plan" in case of novel crises. While some elements of the plan may not directly apply to certain situations, its principles and basic procedures can be adapted and modified to handle new challenges.

In conclusion, having a crisis management plan is crucial to prepare a company to face crises efficiently and remain calm under pressure. Acting quickly and decisively in the moment is also crucial, but a well-developed crisis management plan can help companies to be more effective when handling crises.
